pullRequest.title: fix #2317 Add examples to deprecation notes of processors
pullRequest.bodyText: Add an example in the Javadoc of each deprecated processor to give a hint to users on how to write the equivalent Sink

commit.message: fix #2317 deprecate note with example for processors

nodes.bodyText:
I think Sinks.empty() isn't a valid replacement for DirectProcessor since it can only signal error or complete.
Although I am not sure what would be the replacement :D Let me have a look and get back to you...
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -79,7 +79,8 @@ *

* * @param the input and output value type - * @deprecated Prefer clear cut usage of {@link Sinks}, to be removed in 3.5 + * @deprecated To be removed in 3.5, prefer clear cut usage of {@link Sinks}: + * 
Sinks.empty();
for example.

nodes.bodyText: Consider also mentioning that EmitterProcessor was/is blocking on emitNext, while with the new API one can use tryEmitNext + while with parkNanos or similar waiting strategy to achieve the same
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -51,7 +51,8 @@
  * @param <T> the input and output value type
  *
  * @author Stephane Maldini
- * @deprecated Prefer clear cut usage of {@link Sinks}, to be removed in 3.5
+ * @deprecated To be removed in 3.5. Prefer clear cut usage of {@link Sinks}:

nodes.bodyText: @simonbasle I need your opinion on this one

since there is no "flavor" to the sink method itself (it is driven by the concrete implementation on which it is called), I'd remove the mention of any specific full builder and just say usage of {@code Sinks} through the {@link Sinks#many()} spec (and remove the pre block)
consider just mentioning Sinks.many().unicast() rather than giving a more precise example?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -84,7 +84,8 @@ *

* * @param the input and output type - * @deprecated Prefer clear cut usage of {@link Sinks}, to be removed in 3.5 + * @deprecated to be removed in 3.5, prefer clear cut usage of {@link Sinks}: + * 
Sinks.many().unicast().onBackpressureBuffer()
for example.

nodes.bodyText: consider just mentioning Sinks.many().replay() rather than giving a more precise example?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -48,7 +48,8 @@ *

* * @param the value type - * @deprecated Prefer clear cut usage of {@link Sinks}, to be removed in 3.5 + * @deprecated To be removed in 3.5, prefer clear cut usage of {@link Sinks}: + * 

Sinks.many().replay().all()
or 
Sinks.many().replay().latest()
for example.

nodes.bodyText: rather than "for example": variations of Sinks.many().multicast().onBackpressureBuffer() (since the only other alternative IIRC is onBackpressureError(), which is the DirectProcessor)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -51,7 +51,8 @@ * @param the input and output value type * * @author Stephane Maldini - * @deprecated Prefer clear cut usage of {@link Sinks}, to be removed in 3.5 + * @deprecated To be removed in 3.5. Prefer clear cut usage of {@link Sinks}: + * 
Sinks.many().multicast().onBackpressureBuffer();
for example.

nodes.bodyText: remove the for example, onBackpressureError() is the one and only way to get a DirectProcessor.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -79,7 +79,8 @@ *

* * @param the input and output value type - * @deprecated Prefer clear cut usage of {@link Sinks}, to be removed in 3.5 + * @deprecated To be removed in 3.5, prefer clear cut usage of {@link Sinks}: + * 
Sinks.many().multicast().onBackpressureError();
for example.

nodes.bodyText:
xWhile? :) WDYT about something like: Suggested change * with the {@link Sinks} API by calling {@link Sinks#many()#tryEmitNext(T)} and one of the xWhile method. * with the {@link Sinks} API by calling {@link Sinks#many()#tryEmitNext(T)} and retrying, e.g.: * 
while (sink.tryEmitNext(v).hasFailed()) LockSupport.parkNanos(10);
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -51,7 +52,11 @@ * @param the input and output value type * * @author Stephane Maldini - * @deprecated Prefer clear cut usage of {@link Sinks}, to be removed in 3.5 + * @deprecated To be removed in 3.5. Prefer clear cut usage of {@link Sinks} through + * variations of 
Sinks.many().multicast().onBackpressureBuffer()
. + * + * This processor is blocking on {@link EmitterProcessor#emitNext(T)}. This behaviour can be implemented + * with the {@link Sinks} API by calling {@link Sinks#many()#tryEmitNext(T)} and one of the xWhile method.

commit.message: fix DirectProcessor documentation following latest code review

nodes.bodyText: nitpick: generally in javadocs oneliners like that are added through a {@code xxx} tag rather than html <pre><code>.
nodes.diffHunk:

Sinks.many().multicast().onBackpressureError();
for example. + * 
Sinks.many().multicast().onBackpressureError();
.

nodes.bodyText: this one I'd keep as a <pre><code> indeed, but maybe add newlines and indentation for readability?

commit.message: Polish code snippets and add links as well
